chú thích tạp chí.{{chú thích tạp chí |last: Deborah Shapley |first= |authorlink= |date=1975-8 |title=Science in Vietnam: The Postwar North Seeks American Assistance |journal=Science |volume=189 |issue=4204 |pages=705-707 |id= |doi=10.1126/science.189.4204.705 |url=http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/citation/189/4204/705 |access-date =ngày 5 tháng 1 năm 2010 |quote=[Nguyên văn [[tiếng Anh]] đoạn trích dẫn]: In science and education, unification will probably be patchy at best, since the two countries have developed along different lines for decades. But despite a host of difficulties Galston found the leaders in the North to be openly admiring of many features of science and education in the South; they planned to incorporate them in the North when the much-discussed (but still not formalized) unification takes place. |archive-date = ngày 31 tháng 5 năm 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210531222729/https://science.sciencemag.org/content/189/4204/705 }}
